job_title: Imaging Informatics Administrator in Markham, ON
pros: Wonderful community feeling. Great staff and doctors. Helpful and caring attitude. Patients are the focus. New 2nd building from 2012 and renovated original building. Lots of space. Community centre is attached to hospital - has library, gym, auditorium, swimming pool, and places to sit/relax...great for a quick lunchtime workout.
cons: Would be nice to have a higher annual pay increase to keep up with inflation.

job_title: Diagnostic Radiologic Technologist in Markham, ON
pros: Well organized place to work, good working environment
cons: Young hospital still needs more improving

review_title: New Hospital but always short of staff
pros: Nice new hospital in a community that continues to grow. A good majority of the management team care about their patients and staff. The building is lovely and new but signs of deterioration is starting with dirty units, marks on the walls and dirty floors.
cons: The management team care until it's 1630 and they are off to their respective homes. We're often assigned more patients then normal because we don't have a robust resource pool to pull from. If we get agency in then we must pitch in because they can't use our system. I work at another hospital where the situation is much better because they have a Staffing Office. Sometimes equipment cannot be found or is broken and nobody does anything about it.

review_title: Great hospital to come to when sick - not so great to work in
pros: If you are a patient you'll receive great care from all staff.  It is a caring place if you are a patient or visitor.
cons:
Workload is crazy. They don't give us any food options for lunch (Subway) like other hospitals do. The new management team even took Tim Hortons away why I don't know it was always busy???? 
Old CEO was friendly and smiled and told jokes - new management team doesn't care about the staff only money.

pros: Close to home , 9-5 workday, no overtime
cons:
Where do I begin... 

New Management in Corporate Areas drives good employees out the door as new opinions from employees are not heard. It is disappointing to see new management coming in and letting go half of the capable and hard-working staff in the team. New management at the top gives this place a bad name. 

Inefficiencies across many areas and departments. Hard work is not appreciated and overrun by favortism.  There is reason why government money is so poorly managed.  There are many other places to work at where there is a positive culture and employees are heard. Please avoid; I would have appreciated this if someone told me earlier.

pros: Markham Stouffville Hospital is a very caring Hospital that only strives on giving the best care to its patients and employees. Its a hospital that focuses on team work and making it a great hospital. I  have worked there for 10years and I look forward everyday going to work to put a smile on a fellow employee or patients.face. Markham is a great place to work and i so love the community setting and how its a warm and loving community.
cons: The only down fall for me its so far to drive to work for me.

review_title: Was once good but not anymore.
pros: The long term staff are wonderful and care about the hospital and community.  Core values and treatment of patients is still in tact for the time being.  Don't let this senior management team ruin the reputation of this once fine hospital.
cons: New management team. Don't have a clue and don't care about MSH's amazing history.  They make decisions that make you scratch your heading wondering how they operate.  Mean spirited, patronizing, in it for themselves and no concept on how things really work.

review_title: A staff Registered Nurse  in a Tele/Med unit
pros: Beautiful safe environment to work for in a hospital. Clean Hospital. A good hospital for new nurses to gain experience and skills. Friendly proactive staffs.
cons: Needs improvements in management. Short staffed especially in weekends and holidays always. No Union. Too many injuries amongst the nurses-just means they are overwhelmed and overworked.

pros: High paced. Definitely not bored!  Excellent Customer Service and working environment. Team spirit through departments.  Excellent management team with full support to their employees.
cons: Some staff are not respectful of other's positions or job responsibilities. Being aware that everyone has and does their part to effectively create a positive patient experience is most important.

pros: Best team members,company used latest evidence based care and make it great for the employees and well as the clients.
cons: Non unionized, should consider bringing in the union for the benefit of employees.

pros: Good pay, benefits and pension. Senior management has changed recently and they are taking an interest in what their employees are saying.
cons: A manager I dealt with showed favouritism and was very unprofessional.

review_title: Administrating contrast to patients, while maintaining patient care
